availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Phillips (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of George Phillips and Mary Phillips. Farmer with father George Phillips and brother George Phillips, Jr., in Lebanon, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned twenty-three enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, District 1, p. 584.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 1, p. 479A-B, p. 3-4 of microfilm.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Marion County, KY, July 1863, p. 385, p. 88 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
